title: Cardano Hub Buenos Aires
description: There is no visible Cardano community in Buenos Aires. Argentina suffers from inflation. People lack awareness of Cardano as an option.

f6_assessments.q0: Doing bi-weekly meetup in Spanish language would be attracting many local members to join and learn more about Cardano blockchain. This is very good idea to build local community hub, especially in Buenos Aires. Additional educational workshops align also with the purpose of spreading knowledge about Cardano to bigger audience.
f6_assessments.q1: After checking Bitcoin Bay team, they have experiences on hosting events online via Meetup. Just wondering if they have members from local hub in Buenos Aires to manage the event in Buenos Aires. Budgeting is quite reasonable for 1 year (26 events). Project planning is deliverable in my opinion.
f6_assessments.q2: KPI is quite clear. Community could also track the result via Meetup and check also if they post photo/ article/documentation of each event.

f6_assessments.q0: Hosting a local meetup in Argentine is a great idea and addresses the challenge effectively. Introducing cardano to local communities is a good way to include more people in the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer states that he has experience organising these bitcoin meetup. Since the natures of the work are the same, the proposer should be able to implemente the plan without major issues.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget of this proposal is detailed and the event are easily verifiable. This project can be audited based on the informations provided.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the challenge via a focus on Buenos Aires, the proposing entity, Bitcoin Bay, has a Bitcoin meetup group with 240+ members in Argentina, however that group has not met since April, has no upcoming meetings scheduled, and averaged 3 attendees per meeting according to Meetup. This proposal offers a meet-up model that generates new Cardano holders in part by offering to Airdrop free Ada to non-Ada holders who attend one of their meetings. They have set a goal to grow Cardano holders by just under 600 over the course of a year, at current pricing this would allow each new Cardano holder to be Air Dropped one Ada. Metrics regarding meeting frequency seem reasonable however it remains to be seen if $2.37 is enough to draw 50 new members per meeting.
f6_assessments.q1: While the proposer entity specializes in hosting affinity groups and has experience doing so in Buenos Aires the budget would benefit from the addition of details (e.g. regarding ADA airdrops). The timetable appears to be reasonable given their past history with blockchain-interested meetups in the BA area.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap of milestones is plausible and the metrics for completion appear measurable via the Meetup event logging interface. The use of free food, blockchain-based content, and free Crypto may indeed entice 600 or so members in the span of a year. This may place Cardano and ADA on the lips of Argentinian attendees. The proposing group may want to reconsider the AirDrop approach in general (scammers often claim to offer ADA giveaways and places like the Cardano subreddit underscore the fact that there will not be ADA giveaways) or the amount (should the price of 1 ADA rise above the $3.40 mark).

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is well addressing the challenge and focus on local solution for Buenos Aires. As there is no local hub in the city, it makes sense to have one. The solution is well defined and makese good sense.
It would have good to mention how this format could be duplicated to other cities in Argentina or South America countries. Or if the online sessions could be across countries as well (although I see the value to have it city per city as suggested in the proposal). 

As someone who participated in many tech meetups and worked and lived in many countries including Argentina, I appreciate the importance of local meetups in local language to increase reach and engagamnet. Therefore, making efforts to improve the tools available for the community around localization seems very important and will support the challenge objectives.
f6_assessments.q1:
https://bitcoinbay.ca/ has great and relevant experience for the proposal. They focus on blockchains meetups since 2013 and have managed 100s of events. They also had multiple crypto meetups in Argentina and have a meet-up page set for Buenos Aires Bitcoin with 243 members. This is all great. It could be helpful to have the stats from this meeting such as how many meetings, participants in each meeting, and other helpful information. 

Any past experience of https://bitcoinbay.ca/ with Cardano-related meetup or engagement with Catalyst would be important to include.

The proposal however mentions that "this will be its own independent organization". It would be good to have more information about what does it mean. What team will lead this organization? Is this a model you worked on for other locations? What will be the relationship and support between Bitcoinbay and the new org? 
The proposal also mentions "our contact in Buenos Aires will be able to host…"  - having more information about the contact will have been helpful. 

The plan versus the idea makes good sense. The budget, however, is missing more details for example $3,000 for meetups, and logistics cost could be detailed per cost per meetup * number of meetups. Salary could be a breakout for a number of people/hour/months/$ and so on. Overall the cost of $9,500 for 26 meetups = $365 per meetup sounds reasonable.   

I had a question regarding the budget which was clarified by the team: the budget is for 12 months and 26 meetups but in addition, the team will try to raise more funds through sponsorship.   

Based on the Bitcoinbay track record I am confident the plan is feasible but some clarifications as suggested above are important.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap and timeframes are clear as well as the deliverable. KPIs are also clear and measured by the number of new Cardano holders as well as participants in each meeting.

Finally, it will be important to have a section of challenges and risks to show you considered various scenarios. For example, how do we make sure the meetups include quality Carano content? How meetups with different audiences are managed i.e. developers with knowledge of Cardano vs. newcomers.  Based on the experience of bitcoinbay, I am confident they could provide more information about it and how they will mitigate the risk.

solution: Fund A Cardano Hub in Buenos Aires. Host Spanish language events and provide educational workshops, delivered by local community members.
experience:
Hosting Bitcoin meetups and workshops since 2013

Hosting Multiple crypto meetups in Argentina

Hosting Cardano meetups in Toronto.
